characters.name: Riley
characters.description: A witty, energetic girl with average looks but standout charm.

characters.name: Manager
characters.description: A strict but secretly supportive audition coordinator.

characters.name: Mia
characters.description: Hailey’s hometown friend. Warm, practical, encouraging.

characters.name: Serina
characters.description: A rival singer. Confident, glamorous, intimidating.

characters.name: Prince
characters.description: Riley’s favorite male superstar and audition judge.

characters.name: Judge Clara
characters.description: A kind but sharp female judge who sees potential.

scenes.sceneDescription: Riley sits in a crowded audition waiting room, clutching her audition number. People around her warm up their voices. Her leg won’t stop shaking.

events.text: Riley’s heart is beating way too fast. The audition room feels colder than it should.
Okay, Riley. You can do this. Or… you could pretend you forgot your shoes and go home.
Honestly, my parents’ couch is calling me louder than this audition room.

events.caption: Riley’s phone wallpaper: a cozy photo of her parents’ living room.

events.text: Maybe I should just text them. ‘Surprise! I’m back already.’
Hey. You look like someone who’s about to faint or flee. Which one is it?
Option C. Dramatically disappear and become a librarian.
Relax. You didn’t come all this way to organize books.
What’s your name?
Riley. Future ex-audition contestant.
I’m Mia. And trust me — you already look braver than you feel.
Before Riley can reply, a glamorous girl walks past them, surrounded by whispers.

events.caption: Serina, famous indie singer with a confident smile.

events.text: Wow. She looks like she was born on a spotlight.
That’s Serina. She’s already semi-famous. Try not to compare.
Too late. I just lost the comparison battle and the war.
Riley glances toward the audition room door — and freezes.

events.caption: Three judges sit behind a long desk.

events.text: Wait… is that… Prince?
Yeah. Surprise judge today.
Nope. Absolutely not. I refuse to embarrass myself in front of my favorite singer.
I’m leaving. I’m walking. I’m—
Contestant number 47. Riley Cyrus. You’re up.
Riley’s soul briefly exits her body.

scenes.sceneDescription: Riley walks down a long hallway toward the audition room, feeling like she’s walking into a final boss fight.

events.text: Each step feels louder than the last. Riley considers fainting as a strategic escape plan.
Okay, brain, listen. If I pass out, technically I tried.
You’ll be fine. Just walk straight and don’t trip.
Wow. Inspirational.

events.caption: Riley peeks through the audition room door.

events.text: Inside, three judges sit behind a table. Prince leans back casually, scrolling on his tablet.
Great. My hero. My downfall.
Go get them.
The door opens. There is no turning back.

scenes.sceneDescription: Riley stands alone under bright lights, facing the judges’ table.

events.text: Hello. Please introduce yourself.
Hi, I’m Riley. I’m nervous, underprepared, and extremely aware that I’m sweating.
Prince raises an eyebrow. Judge Clara smiles slightly.
Confidence is… refreshing. What will you perform?
An original song. And possibly a panic attack, depending on how this goes.
Take your time.
Riley closes her eyes and starts singing. Her voice shakes at first, but slowly steadies.

events.caption: Riley sings under the spotlight, eyes closed.

events.text: When she finishes, the room is quiet.
Your pitch control is unstable. Your tone lacks polish. Honestly… this isn’t ready.
Each word feels like a tiny punch to Riley’s chest.
Wow. That hurt more than my last breakup. And that involved crying in public.
Prince blinks, surprised. Judge Clara laughs quietly.
You’re honest. I like that. And your emotion felt real.
You’re not perfect — but you’re interesting.
Interesting doesn’t win competitions.
Neither does fear. And she sang anyway.
Riley grips her hands, waiting.

scenes.sceneDescription: The judges whisper among themselves. Riley tries not to pass out.

events.text: Riley, you lack training — but you have presence. And that’s rare.
I’d like to see what you can do with coaching.
I still don’t think she’s ready.
Then let the next round decide.
The judges turn back to Riley.
Congratulations. You’re through to the first round.
Wait. Sorry. Can you repeat that slower so my brain can process joy?
You passed.
I PASSED?
Riley nearly drops her audition number.
Don’t get comfortable. The next round will be harder.
Great. I love emotional threats. Keeps life exciting.
Prince hides a smile.

scenes.sceneDescription: Riley walks out of the audition room, stunned.

events.text: Well?
I survived. Emotionally injured, but alive.
That’s not an answer.
I passed.
WHAT?!
Mia grabs Riley’s shoulders and shakes her.
See? You didn’t die.
Serina walks past them, expression unreadable.
Beginner’s luck.
Maybe. But I’ll take it.
Riley looks back at the audition room door, her heart still racing — but now, with excitement instead of fear.
Okay, Riley. Don’t mess this up.
This is only the beginning.
